algorithms

Class AlgorithmUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.AlgorithmUtils

  • public class AlgorithmUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing common methods used by PlanningAlgorithms. This class can be extended and overridden to customize the behaviour of the algorithms.

    Created by Daniel Riissanen on 2.4.2018.

    • Constructor Summary

      AlgorithmUtils()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlgorithmUtils

        public AlgorithmUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • isValidSubPlan

        public boolean isValidSubPlan(SubPlan plan,
                              State start)
        Checks if the plan is executable. The conditions are that all requirements should be met and that all actions are valid, meaning that their preconditions are met before executing them.
        Parameters:
        plan - The sub plan to check
        start - The start state from which the sub plan will be executed
        Returns:
        true if the sub plan is valid, false otherwise

      • isUniqueSubPlan

        public boolean isUniqueSubPlan(SubPlan plan,
                               DynamicArray<SubPlan> existingPlans)
        Checks whether a plan already exists in a list of plans. This is useful for optimization purposes.
        Parameters:
        plan - The sub plan to check
        existingPlans - The list of existing sub plans
        Returns:
        true if the sub plan is unique, false otherwise

      • convertToPlan

        public Plan convertToPlan(SubPlan subPlan,
                          boolean isComplete)
        Converts a SubPlan to a Plan. If the argument is null an empty plan is returned.
        Parameters:
        subPlan - The sub plan to convert
        isComplete - Indicates if the plan will take you to the goal
        Returns:
        The converted Plan
